block.p: La-Z-Boy Inc., Monroe, Mich., a manufacturer and retailer of home furnishings, said it would take a pretax charge in the fourth quarter, citing import competition from China. The company said the charge would be $71.9 million, $55.9 million net of tax, or $1.04 a share.
International Steel Group Inc., Richfield, Ohio, the steel manufacturer, has agreed to buy the Georgetown Steel facility, Georgetown, S.C., for $16 million in cash plus assumed liabilities.

Kellogg Co., Battle Creek, Mich., the cereal maker, plans to close a factory in Worthington, Ohio, affecting 300 jobs, and shift production of vegetarian brands including Morningstar Farms to another facility. The costs are expected to be about $30 million.
